name: Agentic AI
notes: Autonomous AI systems capable of setting goals, planning, and taking action with minimal human oversight. Moving beyond chatbots to true agency.

name: Generative AI & Multimodal Models
notes: AI systems processing text, images, video, and audio simultaneously. Already deployed widely but expectations remain inflated.

name: AI-Augmented Software Engineering
notes: AI coding assistants and autonomous development tools. Rapid adoption but productivity claims being scrutinized.

name: AI Safety & Governance Platforms
notes: Tools for monitoring, auditing, and ensuring safe AI deployment. Critical but nascent infrastructure.

name: Multi-Agent Systems
notes: Multiple AI agents collaborating to solve complex problems. Early frameworks emerging but coordination remains challenging.

name: Humanoid Robots
notes: General-purpose robots with human-like form factor. High visibility from Tesla, Figure, etc. but practical deployment years away.

name: Swarm Robotics
notes: Coordinated groups of simple robots for agriculture, logistics, and disaster response. Promising but coordination protocols immature.

name: Edge AI & Federated Learning
notes: Processing AI at the edge with privacy-preserving training. Initial hype fading but real use cases in IoT and mobile emerging.

name: Quantum Computing
notes: Practical quantum advantage remains elusive despite major investments. Error correction is the key bottleneck.

name: Post-Quantum Cryptography
notes: NIST standards published 2024. Organizations beginning systematic migration to quantum-resistant algorithms.

name: Structural Battery Composites
notes: Battery technology integrated into structural components for vehicles and devices. Promising for EVs but manufacturing challenges remain.

name: Green Nitrogen Fixation
notes: Electrochemical and biological alternatives to Haber-Bosch process. Could revolutionize fertilizer production with massive emissions reduction.

name: Next-Gen Nuclear (SMRs)
notes: Small Modular Reactors facing regulatory and cost challenges. Several projects delayed but tech giants renewing interest for data centers.

name: Carbon Capture & Utilization
notes: Direct air capture costs declining but still far from economic viability at scale. Utilization pathways emerging.

name: Engineered Living Therapeutics
notes: Programmable bacteria and cells as therapies. Early clinical trials showing promise but regulatory pathway uncertain.

name: RNA & Epigenetic Therapies
notes: mRNA vaccines proved concept; now expanding to cancer and rare diseases. Epigenetic editing showing early promise.

name: Bio-Digital Interfaces
notes: Brain-computer interfaces from Neuralink, Synchron showing progress. Medical applications advancing faster than consumer.

name: Synthetic Biology Platforms
notes: CRISPR and gene synthesis tools becoming standardized. Commercial applications in materials, food, and medicine scaling.

name: 6G Networks
notes: Standards work beginning for 2030 deployment. Promises terahertz spectrum and integrated sensing but 5G still rolling out.

name: Satellite Internet Constellations
notes: Starlink profitable, competitors launching. Coverage expanding but space debris concerns growing and economics challenging for competitors.

name: Collaborative Sensing Networks
notes: Distributed IoT sensors for environmental monitoring, traffic, infrastructure. Data integration and privacy challenges.

name: Digital Twin of the Customer
notes: AI-powered customer behavior modeling. Marketing hype strong but privacy concerns and actual predictive value being questioned.

name: Superapps
notes: WeChat model proven in Asia. Western attempts (Twitter/X) struggling but concept validated in specific markets and contexts.

name: Machine Customers
notes: AI agents making autonomous purchasing decisions. Early examples in B2B procurement and smart home replenishment.

name: AI-Driven Cyber Defense
notes: AI for threat detection maturing rapidly. Autonomous response systems emerging but human oversight still critical.

name: Quantum-Safe Networking
notes: Network infrastructure implementing PQC and quantum key distribution. Standards emerging but deployment complexity high.

name: Decentralized Digital Identity (DID)
notes: W3C standards exist but adoption slow. User experience and governance challenges. Some government pilots showing promise.

name: Green IT & Sustainable Data Centers
notes: Liquid cooling, renewable energy, and waste heat recovery becoming standard. AI workloads driving new efficiency imperatives.

name: Circular Electronics Manufacturing
notes: Design for disassembly and materials recovery gaining traction. EU regulations accelerating adoption. Economics improving.

name: AI for Climate Resilience
notes: AI models for climate prediction, adaptation planning, and resource optimization. Early deployments in agriculture and urban planning.
